name: The Diplomat Hotel

reviews.title: Poor breakfast service
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Diplomat Hotel. It was overcrowded by numerous coach loads of tourists. The rooms were basic and comfortable. Toilet Paper limited. There were no maids within easy access on each floor. So one could not just pop out and ask for toilet paper. Ended up buying our own extra for when we ran out daily.
The mattress on the one bed in Room 525 was so old that we even turned it around in an effort to get some sleep. One just sunk into the great hollow. It definitely needs to be replaced.

reviews.title: Average Hotel
an average 4 star hotel
reviews.text: Furthermore, one of the kitchen staff in white overalls picked up some cold meat with her BARE HANDS and THREW it onto the next platter. The first time I saw it, I was speechless. However, this was the particular woman's normal procedure and she continued to do it every morning. Needless to say that took our appetite off eating the cold meats and sliced cheese. This was an extremely negative point, since the breakfast buffet was very rich and varied otherwise.

When I asked for English Breakfast tea one of the waitresses told me drink the tea provided. The management should take into consideration that not all guests are accustomed to drinking fruit flavored teas with salty breakfasts.

reviews.text: After consulting endless websites, travel books, friends and other sources, we settled on the Golden Tulip Diplomat based on it's positive reviews here and the price we were able to secure on the internet. I will admit, we knew nothing more than a few details about it, and were TERRIFIED!

reviews.text: We also used the helpful bus information posted here by others (the #119 takes you right to the hotel!) and without it would have been lost right from the airport, as Prague locals are not usually even partly fluent in English.

reviews.text: Upon arriving at the hotel, which we would have missed from the bus had we not noticed the fountain outfront as per the pictures on this site, we were instantly relieved by the modernity and size of the place. After all, you can't run a hotel this size and have it be awful.
reviews.title: great break

reviews.text: Sure enough, right from check-in, the staff were unbelievably friendly...even the manager who greeted us, asked about Vancouver,Canada (where we are from) and without even being asked, gave us an upgrade to a suite.
reviews.title: The Perfect Location......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel ticks all the right boxes; good location (first stop on Metro A which will take you all around the centre of Prague and last stop for bus 119 from the Airport), spacious, warm, newly decorated rooms with huge baths and power showers and a vast, varied breakfast. All in all great value for money. My only complaint would be the bar tariff which is exceptionally high... opposite the hotel and around the corner by the bus depot is a small, friendly, locals (basement) bar where you can pick up a beer for around 70p. Booked hotel through Alpharooms.com.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in Prague

reviews.text: I stayed at the Diplomat hotel from December 6-12, 2006. It was a perfect location. Not in the old town but only a few stops by metro from all the places you want to go. Took bus 119 after getting the week pass from the information desk in the airport. Only cost about $15 for unlimited transportation. Don't forget to stamp it on the bus when you first use it. The bus dropped me off right in front of the hotel. The room was very nice and so was the bathroom--duvet, down pillows, toiletries, great shower pressure, even liked the toilet paper!!! The buffet breakfast was perfect. All you can eat, both hot and cold food. It was totally adequate. Ate enough to get me through lunch. I felt safe going out at night to the opera and the symphony. The Christmas market in the main square was very pretty, didn't buy anything though, no comparison to the ones in Germany. The weather was wonderful, even though December is normally cold. Was perfectly comfy in my down coat and Merrell shoes. Did all my own touring. Went to Dresden by train on my own too. I would highly recommend this hotel (got it in a package through go-today.com - excellent value with the airfare and hotel included).

description: The 4-star Diplomat Hotel Prague is one of the largest hotels in Prague. It is renowned for its excellent conference and event facilities. Surrounded mainly by diplomatic residences and its location close to Prague castle, to the historical city centre and to the international airport, the hotel constitutes the perfect place for business as well as individual city travellers.
